p: The mosquito vectors described in this review are known to be able to transmit several arboviruses that have never been detected in FP. For example, C. annulirostris, C. sitiens and C. quinquefasciatus may transmit Japanese encephalitis virus [51] and, with A. vexans, West Nile virus [43], [52]. Aedes aegypti is a vector of yellow fever virus [53]. Consequently, these arboviruses are a risk for FP. Mosquitoes are vectors of infectious diseases but the role of humans remains central in the introduction of viruses to the region. Vector control remains inseparable from increased surveillance of human transport flows at the international points of entry of FP (i.e. port and airport).
